Song: Can't help falling in love
Artist: Elvis Presley
Composers: George David Weiss,
Hugo Peretti and Luigi Creatore 

Tabbed by DJ
23rd July 2015

Time signature: 12/8

CAPO: 2nd fret 
(Will then sound in the original recorded key of D)

The original 1961 studio recording is in D. 
With any live versions the key varies: the 1968
NBC-TV special is in C, as is a 1973 concert too. 
In another live concert in 1972 he sings it in C#
(Capo at 1st fret to match that one). 

Chord names and fret positions
are relative to the capo:

content.text:
Artist:Tracy Chapman
Song: Fast car
Tabbed by Sam Guthrie
Capo on second fret

(Chords)
[ch]Cmaj7[/ch]  -32000
[ch]G[/ch]*     32002-
[ch]Em7[/ch]    022003
[ch]Dadd11[/ch] --0032
[ch]C[/ch]      -32010
[ch]G[/ch]      320003
[ch]Em[/ch]     022000
[ch]D[/ch]      --0232

[Intro]
[ch]Cmaj7[/ch]  [ch]G[/ch]*  [ch]Em7[/ch]  [ch]Dadd11[/ch] 
[ch]Cmaj7[/ch]  [ch]G[/ch]*  [ch]Em7[/ch]  [ch]Dadd11[/ch] 

[Verse 1]
[ch]Cmaj7[/ch]          [ch]G[/ch]*
You got a fast car.
[ch]Em7[/ch]                 [ch]Dadd11[/ch]
I want a ticket to anywhere.
[ch]Cmaj7[/ch]           [ch]G[/ch]*
Maybe we make a deal,
[ch]Em7[/ch]                    [ch]Dadd11[/ch]
Maybe together we can get somewhere.
[ch]Cmaj7[/ch]             [ch]G[/ch]*
Any place is better.
[ch]Em7[/ch]                      [ch]Dadd11[/ch]
Starting from zero, got nothing to lose.
[ch]Cmaj7[/ch]                 [ch]G[/ch]*
Maybe we'll make something,
[ch]Em7[/ch]               [ch]Dadd11[/ch]     
Me myself, I got nothing to prove.

[Instrumental]
[ch]Cmaj7[/ch]  [ch]G[/ch]*  [ch]Em7[/ch]  [ch]Dadd11[/ch] 
[ch]Cmaj7[/ch]  [ch]G[/ch]*  [ch]Em7[/ch]  [ch]Dadd11[/ch] 

[Verse 2]
[ch]Cmaj7[/ch]          [ch]G[/ch]*
You got a fast car
[ch]Em7[/ch]                 [ch]Dadd11[/ch]
I got a plan to get us out of here:
[ch]Cmaj7[/ch]           [ch]G[/ch]*
I been working at the convenience store,
[ch]Em7[/ch]                 [ch]Dadd11[/ch]
Managed to save just a little bit of money.
[ch]Cmaj7[/ch]          [ch]G[/ch]*
Wont't have to drive too far
[ch]Em7[/ch]                 [ch]Dadd11[/ch]
Just 'cross the border and into the city, 
[ch]Cmaj7[/ch]          [ch]G[/ch]*
You and i can both get jobs
[ch]Em7[/ch]                 [ch]Dadd11[/ch]
And finally see what it means to be living.

[Instrumental] 
[ch]Cmaj7[/ch]  [ch]G[/ch]*  [ch]Em7[/ch]  [ch]Dadd11[/ch] 
[ch]Cmaj7[/ch]  [ch]G[/ch]*  [ch]Em7[/ch]  [ch]Dadd11[/ch] 

[Verse 3]
[ch]Cmaj7[/ch]          [ch]G[/ch]*
You see my old man's got a problem:
[ch]Em7[/ch]                 [ch]Dadd11[/ch]
He live with the bottle, thats the way it is.
[ch]Cmaj7[/ch]          [ch]G[/ch]*
He says his body's too old for working,
[ch]Em7[/ch]                 [ch]Dadd11[/ch]
His body's too young to look like his.
[ch]Cmaj7[/ch]          [ch]G[/ch]*
My mama went off and left him, she wanted more from life than he could give,
[ch]Em7[/ch]                 [ch]Dadd11[/ch]
I said, "Somebody's got to take care of him."
[ch]Cmaj7[/ch]          [ch]G[/ch]*
So I quit school and that's what I did.


[Instrumental]
[ch]Cmaj7[/ch]  [ch]G[/ch]*  [ch]Em7[/ch]  [ch]Dadd11[/ch] 
[ch]Cmaj7[/ch]  [ch]G[/ch]*  [ch]Em7[/ch]  [ch]Dadd11[/ch] 

[Verse 4]
[ch]Cmaj7[/ch]  [ch]G[/ch]* 
You got a fast car
[ch]Em7[/ch]  [ch]Dadd11[/ch] 
But is it fast enough so we can fly away?
[ch]Cmaj7[/ch]  [ch]G[/ch]* 
We gotta make a decision:
[ch]Em7[/ch]  [ch]Dadd11[/ch] 
Leave tonight or live and die this way.

[Bridge]
[ch]Cmaj7[/ch]  [ch]G[/ch]*  [ch]Em7[/ch]  [ch]Dadd11[/ch]  [ch]Cmaj7[/ch]  [ch]G[/ch]*

[Chorus]
[ch]Em[/ch]    [ch]Dadd11[/ch]              [ch]C[/ch]
 I remember when we were driving, driving in your car,
     [ch]G[/ch]
The speed so fast i felt like i was drunk,
[ch]Em7[/ch]
  City lights lay out before us
          [ch]D[/ch]
And your arm felt nice wrapped 'round my shoulder. 
    [ch]C[/ch]   [ch]Em7[/ch]      [ch]D[/ch]  
And I_____ had a feeling that i belonged
    [ch]C[/ch]   [ch]Em7[/ch]      [ch]D[/ch]                           [ch]C[/ch]           [ch]D[/ch]
And I_____ had a feeling i could be someone, be someone, be someone.

[Instrumental]
[ch]Cmaj7[/ch]  [ch]G[/ch]*  [ch]Em7[/ch]  [ch]Dadd11[/ch] 
[ch]Cmaj7[/ch]  [ch]G[/ch]*  [ch]Em7[/ch]  [ch]Dadd11[/ch] 

[Verse 5]
[ch]Cmaj7[/ch]  [ch]G[/ch]*
You got a fast car
 [ch]Em7[/ch]  [ch]Dadd11[/ch] 
And we go cruising to entertain ourelves;
[ch]Cmaj7[/ch]  [ch]G[/ch]*
you still ain't fot a job
 [ch]Em7[/ch]  [ch]Dadd11[/ch] 
And work in a market as a checkout girl.
[ch]Cmaj7[/ch]  [ch]G[/ch]*
I know things will get better:
 [ch]Em7[/ch]  [ch]Dadd11[/ch] 
You'll find work and I'll get promoted, 
[ch]Cmaj7[/ch]  [ch]G[/ch]*
We'll move out of the shelter
 [ch]Em7[/ch]  [ch]Dadd11[/ch] 
Buy a bigger house and live in the suburbs.

[Bridge]
[ch]Cmaj7[/ch]  [ch]G[/ch]*  [ch]Em7[/ch]  [ch]Dadd11[/ch]  [ch]Cmaj7[/ch]  [ch]G[/ch]*

[Chorus]
[ch]Em[/ch]    [ch]Dadd11[/ch]              [ch]C[/ch]
 I remember when we were driving, driving in your car,
     [ch]G[/ch]
The speed so fast i felt like i was drunk,
[ch]Em7[/ch]
  City lights lay out before us
          [ch]D[/ch]
And your arm felt nice wrapped 'round my shoulder. 
    [ch]C[/ch]   [ch]Em7[/ch]      [ch]D[/ch]  
And I_____ had a feeling that i belonged
    [ch]C[/ch]   [ch]Em7[/ch]      [ch]D[/ch]                           [ch]C[/ch]           [ch]D[/ch]
And I_____ had a feeling i could be someone, be someone, be someone.

[Instrumental]
[ch]Cmaj7[/ch]  [ch]G[/ch]*  [ch]Em7[/ch]  [ch]Dadd11[/ch] 
[ch]Cmaj7[/ch]  [ch]G[/ch]*  [ch]Em7[/ch]  [ch]Dadd11[/ch] 

[Verse 6]
[ch]Cmaj7[/ch]  [ch]G[/ch]*
You got a fast car
[ch]Em7[/ch]  [ch]Dadd11[/ch] 
And i got a job that pays all our bills.
[ch]Cmaj7[/ch]  [ch]G[/ch]*
You stay out drinking late at the bar,
[ch]Em7[/ch]  [ch]Dadd11[/ch] 
See more your friends than you do your kids.
[ch]Cmaj7[/ch]  [ch]G[/ch]*
I'd always hoped for better,
[ch]Em7[/ch]  [ch]Dadd11[/ch] 
Thought maybe together you and me would find it,
[ch]Cmaj7[/ch]  [ch]G[/ch]*
I got no plans i ain't going nowhere,
[ch]Em7[/ch]  [ch]Dadd11[/ch] 
so take your fast car and kep on driving.

[Bridge]
[ch]Cmaj7[/ch]  [ch]G[/ch]*  [ch]Em7[/ch]  [ch]Dadd11[/ch]  [ch]Cmaj7[/ch]  [ch]G[/ch]*

[Chorus] 
[ch]Em[/ch]    [ch]Dadd11[/ch]              [ch]C[/ch]
 I remember when we were driving, driving in your car,
     [ch]G[/ch]
The speed so fast i felt like i was drunk,
[ch]Em7[/ch]
  City lights lay out before us
          [ch]D[/ch]
And your arm felt nice wrapped 'round my shoulder. 
    [ch]C[/ch]   [ch]Em7[/ch]      [ch]D[/ch]  
And I_____ had a feeling that i belonged
    [ch]C[/ch]   [ch]Em7[/ch]      [ch]D[/ch]                           [ch]C[/ch]           [ch]D[/ch]
And I_____ had a feeling i could be someone, be someone, be someone.

[Instrumental]
[ch]Cmaj7[/ch]  [ch]G[/ch]*  [ch]Em7[/ch]  [ch]Dadd11[/ch] 
[ch]Cmaj7[/ch]  [ch]G[/ch]*  [ch]Em7[/ch]  [ch]Dadd11[/ch] 

[Verse 7]
[ch]Cmaj7[/ch]  [ch]G[/ch]* 
You got a fast car
[ch]Em7[/ch]  [ch]Dadd11[/ch] 
But is it fast enough so you can fly away?
[ch]Cmaj7[/ch]  [ch]G[/ch]* 
You gotta make a decision:
[ch]Em7[/ch]  [ch]Dadd11[/ch] 
Leave tonight or live and die this way.

[Instrumental]
[ch]Cmaj7[/ch]  [ch]G[/ch]*  [ch]Em7[/ch]  [ch]Dadd11[/ch]

Fast Car chords
Tracy Chapman 1988 (Tracy Chapman)

[ch]Em[/ch]                 [ch]D[/ch]

[ch]Cmaj7[/ch]        [ch]G[/ch]

[ch]Em[/ch]                      [ch]D[/ch]

[ch]Cmaj7[/ch]            [ch]G[/ch]

[ch]Em[/ch]               [ch]D[/ch]

[ch]Cmaj7[/ch]                 [ch]G[/ch]

[ch]Em[/ch]                     [ch]D[/ch]

[ch]Cmaj7[/ch]                   [ch]G[/ch]
Won't have to drive too far
[ch]Em[/ch]                         [ch]D[/ch]

[ch]Cmaj7[/ch]         [ch]G[/ch]
You and I can both get jobs
    [ch]Em[/ch]                  [ch]D[/ch]
And finally see what it means to be living.

         [ch]Cmaj7[/ch]                  [ch]G[/ch]
I said, "Somebody's got to take care of him."
   [ch]Em[/ch]                       [ch]D[/ch]

Set8

http://sites.google.com/site/guitarmusicchordsandlyrics/

I found the Cadd9 chord a much nicer sound and seems to be a better fit than the 
chords used in the previous versions on here. I also continued the chord patterns 
throughout the entire song for us newbies, not just once for the first verse and 
first chorus, etc.

IN THE CHORUS, YOU CAN CHANGE IT UP A BIT IF YOU'D LIKE (C [in place of Cmaj7], G 
[in place of Cadd9], and D [in place of Dadd4]). THE CHOICE IS YOURS.

Capo II
Standard Tuning

name: So Far Away
tuning: E A D G B E

content.text:
Play it in standard (EADGBE) or Drop D (DADGBE). Which ever sounds better to you.


[Verse 1]
[ch]Em[/ch]
Never feared for anything
[ch]Em[/ch]
Never shamed but never free
  [ch]G[/ch]                [ch]D[/ch]
A life to heal the broken heart
     [ch]Bm[/ch]          [ch]C[/ch]    
With all that it could

[ch]Em[/ch]
Lived the life so endlessly
[ch]Em[/ch]
Saw beyond what others see
  [ch]G[/ch]                  [ch]D[/ch]
I tried to heal your broken heart
     [ch]Bm[/ch]         [ch]C[/ch]
With all that I could

[Bridge]
[ch]C[/ch]
Will you stay
[ch]D[/ch]
Will you stay away forever?

[Chorus]
[ch]Em[/ch]                        [ch]G[/ch]
How do I live without the ones I love?
[ch]Am[/ch]                                [ch]Em/G[/ch]       [ch]D[/ch]  
Time still turns the pages of the book, it's burned
[ch]Em[/ch]                     [ch]G[/ch]
Place and time, always on my mind
  [ch]Am[/ch]                                [ch]C[/ch]    [ch]D[/ch] 
I have so much to say but you're so far away

[Verse 2]
[ch]Em[/ch]
Plans of what our futures hold
[ch]Em[/ch]
Foolish lies of grown and old
    [ch]G[/ch]              [ch]D[/ch]
It seems we're so invincible
    [ch]Bm[/ch]          [ch]C[/ch]
The truth is so cold

[ch]Em[/ch]
A final song, a last request
[ch]Em[/ch]
A perfect chapter laid to rest
[ch]G[/ch]              [ch]D[/ch]
Now and then I try to find
    [ch]Bm[/ch]          [ch]C[/ch]
The place in my mind

[Bridge]
[ch]C[/ch]
Where you can stay
[ch]D[/ch]

as i think some of the Bm chords are supposed to be Bsus4 
chords. During most of the D major chords in this song, 
he does a little fill on the high E while keeping the rest 
of the chord fretted.
 e)--2-2-2-3-2-0<<.. Like that.

guitar (12 string i think), he uses some different voicings 
to create a melody... I believe those voicings are mostly 
sus4 chords.
